file_content.text: Shed blood in the name of the Master, Revanite.
Get going. The major's expecting you.
Revan earned the respect of my grandfathers and grandmothers by defeating them in battle. Now you've earned mine.
You're no Revan--not yet, at least--but you're something. You've got my approval to join the order.
Thank you.
I assume we're done.
I'm finished. You're not.
I'd rather have your blood.
You scum.
Finish your initiation first. Until then, you're no Revanite, and you don't have the right to challenge us.
If you can't finish off a few of my clansmen, you're not worth my time.
Takan! Have some of the men head into the city. They've earned a break from training.
Yes, Commander!
It's good to see you alive--not everyone makes it past Morrun.
Raymon contacted me from the base--said you wanted to join our society. Is it true?
It's true. I'm seeking the approval of the inner circle.
Yes.
Maybe.
I'm called Ceta Farr. I teach these mercenaries how to fight. My service to the Master is a matter of honor.
Should we be discussing this in public?
Is it safe to talk?
My people won't talk, and I've swept the area for bugs. We'll discuss it now.
Centuries ago, my clan fought Revan when we invaded the Republic with the rest of the Mandalorians. It was our privilege to battle Jedi.
We lost the war over Malachor Five--but that was a privilege, too. It's out of respect for Revan that I agreed to join the Master.
I see what you're saying.
Right.
Huh?
Mandalorians honor their foes--we respect a hard-earned victory.
That's stupid.
I'm bound by blood and honor. That's the Mandalorian way.
I serve the order to ensure Revan's name isn't forgotten. Revan was a warrior, a leader, and deserves to be remembered.
Since you're not bound by honor, how do I know you won't sully the Dark Lord's memory? What can you do for the order in Revan's name?
I can fight. I'll battle the order's enemies wherever there's need.
Defeat our foes.
Good. But I need proof of that.
I'll learn all I can about Revan's past.
I can unearth history.
Fine. The order has enough warriors. You might be able to serve.
You'll need to talk to one more person before you head back to the compound. Find Major Pathel--he oversees security on the Wall.
On my way.
He's about to meet the next great Revanite.
He'll be impressed.
Hardly worthy of me.
Glory to Mandalore... and glory to our Master.
I will gain power to rival Revan.
I'll become mighty.
I can unlock the secrets of Revan's power.
I'll discover precious lore.
I can work inside the Empire. I can help them accept the order.
I'll help Imperial relations.
The Revan I know was a warrior--not a diplomat.
Revan's long dead--there's nothing left to honor.
Why bother with Revan?
Is that so? Fine--you want to say garbage like that, you can prove you're worth my time.
I sent out a squad of clansmen to hunt the local wildlife. They're camped nearby; defeat them or get yourself killed.
And don't worry--Takan here will make sure they know you're coming.
Yes, Commander!
I'm not looking for work right now--find yourself another mercenary.
